intro: Forbesia plicata var. veratrifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf forbesia, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes buttercups and other showy flowers. The plant features finely divided, pinnately compound leaves that give it a lacy appearance. Its flowers are small, white, and clustered in loose racemes, often appearing in early spring. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
